facts:
Patient presents with lower back pain radiating to left leg following motor vehicle accident on
03/01/2024.
History of Present Illness:
45-year-old male involved in rear-end collision on 03/01/2024. Reports onset of low back pain
immediately after accident. Pain rated 7/10.
Physical Exam:
Vital Signs: BP 130/85, HR 78, Temp 98.6F. Lumbar spine: tenderness at L4-L5. Straight leg raise
positive on l; 1. Lumbar disc herniation, L4-L5 2. Left-sided radiculopathy 3. Cervical strain; 1. Order MRI lumbar spine 2. Prescribe Naproxen 500mg BID 3. Refer to physical therapy 2-3x/week 4.; Follow up in 2 weeks; Restrictions: No lifting over 10 lbs, no prolonged sitting. Light duty only.
1. L4-L5 disc herniation with left foraminal narrowing and L5 nerve root impingement. 2. No fracture or; significant stenosis identified. 3. Recommend clinical correlation.
PT sessions documented: 1; Patient tolerated treatment well. Goals: reduce pain to 3/10 by week 6.
